channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Health Index Estimation Through Integration of General Knowledge with Unsupervised Learning
item.description: Hybrid models combining prior knowledge about degradation with deep learning models have been proposed to overcome this challenge.

item.title: OpenESS: Event-based Semantic Scene Understanding with Open Vocabularies
item.description: Event-based semantic segmentation (ESS) is a fundamental yet challenging task for event camera sensing.

item.title: Pedestrian Attribute Recognition as Label-balanced Multi-label Learning
item.description: Rooting in the scarcity of most attributes, realistic pedestrian attribute datasets exhibit unduly skewed data distribution, from which two types of model failures are delivered: (1) label imbalance: model predictions lean greatly towards the side of majority labels; (2) semantics imbalance: model is easily overfitted on the under-represented attributes due to their insufficient semantic diversity.

item.title: Multi-Modal Data-Efficient 3D Scene Understanding for Autonomous Driving
item.description: Efficient data utilization is crucial for advancing 3D scene understanding in autonomous driving, where reliance on heavily human-annotated LiDAR point clouds challenges fully supervised methods.

item.title: A Sparse Tensor Generator with Efficient Feature Extraction
item.description: Sparse tensor operations are gaining attention in emerging applications such as social networks, deep learning, diagnosis, crime, and review analysis.

item.title: HILCodec: High Fidelity and Lightweight Neural Audio Codec
item.description: The recent advancement of end-to-end neural audio codecs enables compressing audio at very low bitrates while reconstructing the output audio with high fidelity.

item.title: Harnessing the Power of MLLMs for Transferable Text-to-Image Person ReID
item.description: Thus, we propose a novel method that uses MLLMs to caption images according to various templates.

item.title: FinePOSE: Fine-Grained Prompt-Driven 3D Human Pose Estimation via Diffusion Models
item.description: We further extend FinePOSE to multi-human pose estimation.

item.title: DiffMatch: Visual-Language Guidance Makes Better Semi-supervised Change Detector
item.description: Motivated by this, we first propose a VLM-based mixed change event generation (CEG) strategy to yield pseudo labels for unlabeled CD data.

item.title: General Place Recognition Survey: Towards Real-World Autonomy
item.description: We conclude with a discussion on PR's future directions, accompanied by a summary of the literature covered and access to our open-source library, available to the robotics community at: https://github. com/MetaSLAM/GPRS.

item.title: EVA-X: A Foundation Model for General Chest X-ray Analysis with Self-supervised Learning
item.description: The diagnosis and treatment of chest diseases play a crucial role in maintaining human health.

item.title: Real-Time Motion Detection Using Dynamic Mode Decomposition
item.description: Dynamic Mode Decomposition (DMD) is a numerical method that seeks to fit timeseries data to a linear dynamical system.

item.title: Communication-Efficient Collaborative Perception via Information Filling with Codebook
item.description: It inherently results in a fundamental trade-off between perception ability and communication cost.

item.title: Molecule-Space: Free Lunch in Unified Multimodal Space via Knowledge Fusion
item.description: Unified multi-model representation spaces are the foundation of multimodal understanding and generation.

item.title: SVDD Challenge 2024: A Singing Voice Deepfake Detection Challenge Evaluation Plan
item.description: The rapid advancement of AI-generated singing voices, which now closely mimic natural human singing and align seamlessly with musical scores, has led to heightened concerns for artists and the music industry.

item.title: Open Source Language Models Can Provide Feedback: Evaluating LLMs' Ability to Help Students Using GPT-4-As-A-Judge
item.description: Inspired by recent work that has utilised very powerful LLMs, such as GPT-4, to evaluate the outputs produced by less powerful models, we conduct an automated analysis of the quality of the feedback produced by several open source models using a dataset from an introductory programming course.

item.title: The Entropy Enigma: Success and Failure of Entropy Minimization
item.description: After many steps of optimization, EM makes the model embed test images far away from the embeddings of training images, which results in a degradation of accuracy.

item.title: HMANet: Hybrid Multi-Axis Aggregation Network for Image Super-Resolution
item.description: For the super-resolution task in the training phase, a novel pre-training method is designed to enhance the model representation capabilities further and validate the proposed model's effectiveness through many experiments.

item.title: Towards Efficient Training and Evaluation of Robust Models against $l_0$ Bounded Adversarial Perturbations
item.description: Furthermore, we combine sparse-PGD with a black-box attack to comprehensively and more reliably evaluate the models' robustness against $l_0$ bounded adversarial perturbations.

item.title: VisionGraph: Leveraging Large Multimodal Models for Graph Theory Problems in Visual Context
item.description: Large Multimodal Models (LMMs) have achieved impressive success in visual understanding and reasoning, remarkably improving the performance of mathematical reasoning in a visual context.

item.title: DALK: Dynamic Co-Augmentation of LLMs and KG to answer Alzheimer's Disease Questions with Scientific Literature
item.description: With a synergized framework of LLM and KG mutually enhancing each other, we first leverage LLM to construct an evolving AD-specific knowledge graph (KG) sourced from AD-related scientific literature, and then we utilize a coarse-to-fine sampling method with a novel self-aware knowledge retrieval approach to select appropriate knowledge from the KG to augment LLM inference capabilities.

item.title: Multi-scale Bottleneck Transformer for Weakly Supervised Multimodal Violence Detection
item.description: In the pursuit of effective multimodal violence detection (MVD), information redundancy, modality imbalance, and modality asynchrony are identified as three key challenges.

item.title: How does GPT-2 Predict Acronyms? Extracting and Understanding a Circuit via Mechanistic Interpretability
item.description: We discover that the prediction is performed by a circuit composed of 8 attention heads (~5% of the total heads) which we classified in three groups according to their role.

item.title: Granite Code Models: A Family of Open Foundation Models for Code Intelligence
item.description: Increasingly, code LLMs are being integrated into software development environments to improve the productivity of human programmers, and LLM-based agents are beginning to show promise for handling complex tasks autonomously.

item.title: Enhancing the Efficiency and Accuracy of Underlying Asset Reviews in Structured Finance: The Application of Multi-agent Framework
item.description: Structured finance, which involves restructuring diverse assets into securities like MBS, ABS, and CDOs, enhances capital market efficiency but presents significant due diligence challenges.

item.title: DocRes: A Generalist Model Toward Unifying Document Image Restoration Tasks
item.description: This underscores the potential of DocRes across a broader spectrum of document image restoration tasks.

item.title: Policy Learning with a Language Bottleneck
item.description: Modern AI systems such as self-driving cars and game-playing agents achieve superhuman performance, but often lack human-like features such as generalization, interpretability and human inter-operability.

item.title: Acceleration Algorithms in GNNs: A Survey
item.description: To address the critical challenges, a range of algorithms have been proposed to accelerate training and inference of GNNs, attracting increasing attention from the research community.

item.title: Vision Mamba: A Comprehensive Survey and Taxonomy
item.description: In the field of deep learning, state space models are used to process sequence data, such as time series analysis, natural language processing (NLP) and video understanding.

item.title: Generating Feature Vectors from Phonetic Transcriptions in Cross-Linguistic Data Formats
item.description: When comparing speech sounds across languages, scholars often make use of feature representations of individual sounds in order to determine fine-grained sound similarities.

item.title: CleanGraph: Human-in-the-loop Knowledge Graph Refinement and Completion
item.description: CleanGraph allows users to perform Create, Read, Update, and Delete (CRUD) operations on their graphs, as well as apply models in the form of plugins for graph refinement and completion tasks.

item.title: FRACTAL: An Ultra-Large-Scale Aerial Lidar Dataset for 3D Semantic Segmentation of Diverse Landscapes
item.description: To bridge this data gap, we present the FRench ALS Clouds from TArgeted Landscapes (FRACTAL) dataset: an ultra-large-scale aerial Lidar dataset made of 100, 000 dense point clouds with high-quality labels for 7 semantic classes and spanning 250 km$^2$.

item.title: Structured Click Control in Transformer-based Interactive Segmentation
item.description: Then the graph nodes will be aggregated to obtain structured interaction features.

item.title: IMU-Aided Event-based Stereo Visual Odometry
item.description: In this paper, we improve our previous direct pipeline \textit{Event-based Stereo Visual Odometry} in terms of accuracy and efficiency.

item.title: MEDVOC: Vocabulary Adaptation for Fine-tuning Pre-trained Language Models on Medical Text Summarization
item.description: In contrast to existing domain adaptation approaches in summarization, MEDVOC treats vocabulary as an optimizable parameter and optimizes the PLM vocabulary based on fragment score conditioned only on the downstream task's reference summaries.

item.title: QServe: W4A8KV4 Quantization and System Co-design for Efficient LLM Serving
item.description: The key insight driving QServe is that the efficiency of LLM serving on GPUs is critically influenced by operations on low-throughput CUDA cores.

item.title: Learning Linear Block Error Correction Codes
item.description: In this work, we propose for the first time a unified encoder-decoder training of binary linear block codes.

item.title: LTLDoG: Satisfying Temporally-Extended Symbolic Constraints for Safe Diffusion-based Planning
item.description: Operating effectively in complex environments while complying with specified constraints is crucial for the safe and successful deployment of robots that interact with and operate around people.

item.title: DeepSeek-V2: A Strong, Economical, and Efficient Mixture-of-Experts Language Model
item.description: MLA guarantees efficient inference through significantly compressing the Key-Value (KV) cache into a latent vector, while DeepSeekMoE enables training strong models at an economical cost through sparse computation.

item.title: Efficient Sharpness-aware Minimization for Molecular Graph Transformer Models
item.description: Sharpness-aware minimization (SAM) has received increasing attention in computer vision since it can effectively eliminate the sharp local minima from the training trajectory and mitigate generalization degradation.

item.title: Revisiting character-level adversarial attacks
item.description: Adversarial attacks in Natural Language Processing apply perturbations in the character or token levels.

item.title: Differentially Private Post-Processing for Fair Regression
item.description: This paper describes a differentially private post-processing algorithm for learning fair regressors satisfying statistical parity, addressing privacy concerns of machine learning models trained on sensitive data, as well as fairness concerns of their potential to propagate historical biases.

item.title: Contextualization with SPLADE for High Recall Retrieval
item.description: High Recall Retrieval (HRR), such as eDiscovery and medical systematic review, is a search problem that optimizes the cost of retrieving most relevant documents in a given collection.

item.title: Navigating Chemical Space with Latent Flows
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new framework, ChemFlow, to traverse chemical space through navigating the latent space learned by molecule generative models through flows.

item.title: Fast Exact Retrieval for Nearest-neighbor Lookup (FERN)
item.description: Unfortunately the algorithm deteriorates rapidly to a $O(dN)$ solution at high dimensions (e. g. $k=128$), in practice.

item.title: ACEGEN: Reinforcement learning of generative chemical agents for drug discovery
item.description: In recent years, reinforcement learning (RL) has emerged as a valuable tool in drug design, offering the potential to propose and optimize molecules with desired properties.

item.title: Learning To See But Forgetting To Follow: Visual Instruction Tuning Makes LLMs More Prone To Jailbreak Attacks
item.description: Augmenting Large Language Models (LLMs) with image-understanding capabilities has resulted in a boom of high-performing Vision-Language models (VLMs).

item.title: Representation Learning of Daily Movement Data Using Text Encoders
item.description: Time-series representation learning is a key area of research for remote healthcare monitoring applications.

item.title: Bidirectional Adversarial Autoencoders for the design of Plasmonic Metasurfaces
item.description: An example of this is the design of photonic metasurfaces by using their photoluminescent spectrum as the input data to predict their topology.

item.title: Fine-grained Speech Sentiment Analysis in Chinese Psychological Support Hotlines Based on Large-scale Pre-trained Model
item.description: However, the high demand for psychological interventions often results in a shortage of professional operators, highlighting the need for an effective speech emotion recognition model.
